AFISH.OL.summary: Arctic Fish Holding AS, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the salmon farming activities in Iceland. It produces smolt, fry, and rainbow trout in the freshwater hatchery. The company offers its products under the ICEBORN brand name. It exports its products to the European countries, the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and China for industrial and retail markets. The company was founded in 2011 and is based in ÃsafjÃ¶rÃ°ur, Iceland.

ARION-SDB.ST.summary: Arion banki hf. provides various financial services to households, corporates, and investors in Iceland and internationally. It operates through three segments: Retail Banking, Corporate & Investment Banking, and Markets. The Retail Banking segment offers a range of products and services, including mortgage loans, savings and current accounts, vehicle and equipment financing, factoring, payment cards, pension services, and insurance and funds to individuals and SMEs through a network of 19 branches with approximately 100,000 customers. The Corporate & Investment Banking segment provides a range of lending products, such as guarantees, deposit accounts, payment solutions, and value-added digital solutions to large and medium-sized corporate clients and investors; international transactions; and various financial advisory and capital raising services, including M&A and LBO services, as well as financial structuring advice, and services on public offerings of securities. The Markets segment manages financial assets on behalf of its customers, as well as a range of mutual, investment, and institutional investor funds; administers pension funds; and provides various fixed income services and risk management products. The company also offers liquidity, currency, and interest rate management services, as well as handles various debt issuance in the domestic and foreign markets, and maintaining its credit ratings; provides non-life and life insurance; and invests in properties. The company was founded in 2008 and is headquartered in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

BRIM.IC.summary: Brim hf. operates as a seafood company in Iceland. It processes and sells various seafood products that include ground fish, pelagic fish, deep sea redfish, golden redfish, haddock, cod, saithe, greenland halibut, lumpfish, capelin, herring, blue whiting, silver smelt, and Atlantic mackerel, as well as various other species. The company also processes trimmings of capelin, herring, blue whiting, and mackerel; and provides fishmeal and dried fish products, as well as various types of products processed from roe. It offers its products primarily in Europe, Asia, and North America. The company was formerly known as HB Grandi hf. And changed its name to Brim hf. in August 2019. Brim hf. is based in Reykjavik, Iceland.

EIK.IC.summary: Eik fasteignafÃ©lag hf. invests in, owns, operates, and leases commercial real estate properties. Its property portfolio includes commercial and office buildings, industrial and storage facilities, hotels and restaurants, and wellness and other properties. The company was founded in 2002 is headquartered in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

EIM.IC.summary: EimskipafÃ©lag Ãslands hf., together with its subsidiaries, provides shipping, logistics, and supply chain management services. The company operates through two segments, Liner Services and Forwarding Services. It offers its solutions on land, sea, and air with focus on the handling and storing various types of temperature-controlled cargo, frozen or chilled, and dry cargo. The company engages in the transportation of goods to and from Iceland, Norway, and the Faroe Islands through its service routes on the North Atlantic. Its services include sea transportation, trucking, warehousing, and logistic services, as well as terminals operations. The company also operates a fleet of reefer, container, refrigerated bulk, and multipurpose container/bulk vessels. EimskipafÃ©lag Ãslands hf. was founded in 1914 and is headquartered in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

FESTI.IC.summary: Festi hf., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the retail sale of fuel in Iceland. It operates through KrÃ³nan, N1, and ELKO segments. The company operates 68 fuel service stations, 11 electricity service stations in co-operation with ON, and one methane service station for vehicles; 27 service stations that offer refreshments and healthy snacks under the Nesti brand; 11 lubrication and tyre garages; and six corporate stores and 52 maritime fuel pumps. It also operates 22 convenience stores under the KrÃ³nan and Kr brand names; two convenience stores under the Kjarval brand name; a store under the NÃ³atÃºn brand name; five electronic stores under the Elko brand name, as well as an online store; and a warehouse hotel that provides product storage, packing, labelling, and product distribution services under the Bakkinn brand. It also leases non-residential real estate properties. The company was formerly known as N1 hf. and changed its name to Festi hf. in September 2018. Festi hf. is headquartered in Kopavogur, Iceland.

HAGA.IC.summary: Hagar hf. operates retail stores in Iceland. Its stores offer food, beauty products, leisure products, and seasonal products, as well as sells apparel and accessories for ladies, men, and children; sports and outdoor recreation equipment; and nursing products, health products, cosmetics, and sanitary products. The company also imports and distributes fruits and vegetables; processes meat; and provides customs processing, stock keeping and order fulfillment, product labeling, and other services. The company operates 40 grocery stores, 28 OlÃ­s service centers, 43 OB stations, two supply stores, three specialty stores, two pharmacies, two warehouses, and two production centers. Hagar hf. is headquartered in Kopavogur, Iceland.

HAMP.IC.summary: Hampidjan Hf. manufactures and sells fishing nets, ropes, and fishing long lines for the fishing fleet in Iceland. The company offers fishing products, including trawls, trawl doors, purse seines, warps and ropes, data, and netting products, as well as various hardware used for fishing. It also provides ropes for yachting, off road, military, and offshore applications; towing solutions comprising separation and wide tow ropes, and deflector straps; mooring ropes for wire replacement; towing ropes for harbor towing, harbor tugging, and open sea and emergency towing; lifting products; and ropes and nets for sports. The company was founded in 1934 and is headquartered in Reykjavik, Iceland.

I6X.MU.summary: Icelandic Salmon AS engages in salmon farming and production activities in the Westfjords, Iceland. The company was formerly known as Arnarlax AS and changed its name to Icelandic Salmon AS in October 2020. Icelandic Salmon AS was founded in 2009 and is based in BÃ­ldudalur, Iceland. Icelandic Salmon AS is a subsidiary of SalMar ASA.

ICEAIR.IC.summary: Icelandair Group hf., together with its subsidiaries, operates in the airline and tourism sectors. The company operates through three segments: International Flight Operations, Aviation Investments, and Tourism Investments. It offers air travel and air cargo services; and aircraft, crew, maintenance, insurance, and charter services for the international passenger airlines and tour operators. The company also operates hotels; and offers various travelling services for categories, such as leisure, meetings, incentives, conferences, and events, as well as cruise services. In addition, it provides airport ground handling services for airlines and passengers; and leisure tours for organized groups and individuals comprising vacation tours, golf and ski trips, and city breaks. Further, the company offers various financial services, such as sales and sales audit, flown revenue, refunds, accounting, management reporting, credit management, and payroll and related services. As of December 31, 2018, it operated a fleet of 51 aircraft, including 42 owned and 9 leased aircraft. The company operates in North America, Iceland, West Continental Europe, Scandinavia, the United Kingdom, and internationally. The company was founded in 1937 and is based in Reykjavik, Iceland.

ICESEA.IC.summary: Iceland Seafood International hf., together with its subsidiaries, processes, sells, and distributes seafood products primarily in Iceland and internationally. The company operates through Value Added Southern Europe, Value Added Northern Europe, and Sales and Distribution segments. It provides ready meals, fresh seafood, coated products, landfrozen, shell fish, smoked fish, light and wet salted, frozen at sea, pelagic fish, dried products, and cephalopods. The company offers its products under the Islandia, Batter Me Up, Banord, Iceland Gold, Havelok, Islandia Armengol, Las Tapas de Islandia Armengol, OceanPath, Dunn's, Icelandic Seafood, and Seastar brands. It also exports its products. The company was founded in 1932 and is headquartered in Reykjavik, Iceland.

IFISH.OL.summary: Ice Fish Farm AS operates as a fish farm in Iceland. The company engages in the farming of salmon fishes. In addition, it operates smolt stations. The company was incorporated in 2020 and is headquartered in Seltjarnarnes, Iceland. Ice Fish Farm AS is a subsidiary of NTS ASA.

ISLAX.OL.summary: Icelandic Salmon AS engages in salmon farming and production activities in the Westfjords, Iceland. The company was formerly known as Arnarlax AS and changed its name to Icelandic Salmon AS in October 2020. Icelandic Salmon AS was founded in 2009 and is based in BÃ­ldudalur, Iceland. Icelandic Salmon AS is a subsidiary of SalMar ASA.

KALD.IC.summary: KaldalÃ³n hf. operates as a real estate development company in Iceland. It engages in the construction of residential real estate projects. The company is based in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

KVIKA.IC.summary: Kvika banki hf., a specialized bank, provides asset management and investment products and services in Iceland and the United Kingdom. Its products and services include fund management services; finances to enterprises; loans to institutional investors; financing solutions, including project financing, portfolio financing, bridge lending, mezzanine lending, and wholesale funding for fintech solution providers; securities brokerage and foreign exchange market services; and advisory services related to investments and financing with a focus on corporate acquisitions and divestments, and initial public offerings. The company's products and services also include investment banking services with a focus on acquisitions, divestments and mergers, financing and financial restructuring, and listings and delisting of equities and bonds; services to listed companies and companies seeking to list on a regulated stock exchange; and private banking and deposit products and services to high-net worth individuals, businesses, and market participants. It also provides property and casualty, marine, and life and health insurance products and services primarily in Iceland; asset leasing products and services by financing commercial equipment, real estate, and vehicles for companies and individuals; and operational lease services. The company was founded in 1956 and is headquartered in Reykjavik, Iceland.

MAREL.AS.summary: Marel hf. develops, manufactures, sells, and distributes processing equipment, systems, software, and services for poultry, meat, and fish industries. The company's Poultry Processing segment offers integrated systems, software, and services for processing broilers, turkeys, and ducks. Its Meat Processing segment provides services in the processes of slaughtering, cut-up, deboning and trimming, and case ready food service for pork, beef, veal, and sheep. The company's Fish Processing segment offers equipment and systems for farmed and wild salmon and whitefish processing. The company also provides lifecycle support, customer support center, training, process consultancy, planned maintenance, inspection visit, preventative maintenance package, calibration, consumable package, repair and exchange program, and parts package services, as well as upgrade kits. It sells in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, Asia, and Oceania. The company was founded in 1977 and is based in GarÃ°abÃ¦r, Iceland.

ORIGO.IC.summary: Origo hf. provides IT services and solutions in Iceland and Sweden. It provides Aurora Cloud, an enterprise class solution; Cloud Compliance and Quality, a cloud-based quality management solution; Caren, a cloud-based car rental system; and healthcare software solution. It also offers cloud and SAP based payroll and human resource management systems. In addition, the company provides applications development, systems integration, facilities management, project and portfolio management, business process consultancy, consulting, and managed services, as well as develops Websites and Web applications for the travel, and film and broadcast industry. It focuses on the healthcare, financial services, logistics, and aviation industries, as well as the government sector. The company was formerly known as NÃ½herji hf. and changed its name to Origo hf. in February 2018. Origo hf. was founded in 1899 and is headquartered in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

OSSR.CO.summary: Ãssur hf., together with its subsidiaries, designs, develops, produces, and sells non-invasive orthopedic products in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, and the Asia-Pacific. It offers prosthetics products, including artificial limbs and related products for amputees; and lower and upper limb prosthetic components, including feet, knees, hands, fingers, liners, and other components. The company also provides bracing and supports products, such as supporting devices for spinal, knee, hip, foot, ankle, and hands that are primarily used to support joints and other body parts for therapeutic and preventative purposes; and injury solutions to enhance the healing process of bone and soft tissue injuries. It serves specialized healthcare providers, including orthopedic and prosthetic clinics, hospitals, and surgery centers. The company sells its products through its direct sales networks and distributors. Ãssur hf. was founded in 1971 and is headquartered in Reykjavik, Iceland. Ãssur hf. is a subsidiary of William Demant Invest A/S.

REGINN.IC.summary: Reginn hf., a real estate company, invests in, leases, and manages commercial properties in Iceland. As of December 31, 2019, the company owns 116 properties. Reginn hf. was founded in 2009 and is based in KÃ³pavogur, Iceland.

REITIR.IC.summary: Reitir fasteignafÃ©lag hf. engages in the rental of commercial properties in Iceland. The company's property portfolio includes retail, shopping, industrial, office, and hotel real estate properties. It owns 140 buildings covering an area of approximately 465,000 square meters. The company is based in Reykjavik, Iceland.

SIMINN.IC.summary: SÃ­minn hf., a telecommunication company, provides communication solutions in Iceland and internationally. The company operates through seven segments: Mobile, Fixed Voice, Internet and Network, TV, IT Services, Equipment Sales, and Others. It offers mobile services; fixed voice services; data services, including xDSL service, GPON, internet, IP net, core network, local loop, and access network; TV broadcast and distribution services; and hosting, advisory, telecommunication, and operation services, as well as sells IT related hardware and telecommunication equipment. The company also sells products online. SÃ­minn hf. was founded in 1906 and is headquartered in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

SJOVA.IC.summary: SjÃ³vÃ¡-Almennar tryggingar hf. operates as an insurance company in Iceland. The company offers motor vehicle, family and home, life and critical illness, and medical cost insurance products for individuals. It also provides commercial insurance products, such as fire and commercial property insurance; public and product liability, employer's liability, directors and officers liability, professional indemnity, and commercial liability insurance; operation interruption insurance; vessel crew, hull and machinery, and catch and fishing gear/tackle insurance; vessel cargo, transport cargo, and purse seine insurance; baggage, sickness and accidents on travelling, and cancelation insurance; and insurance products for employees and leaders. The company is based in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland. SjÃ³vÃ¡-Almennar tryggingar hf. was founded in 1918 and is a subsidiary of SF1 slhf.

SKEL.IC.summary: Skeljungur hf., together with its subsidiaries, imports, distributes, and sells oil, lubricants, chemical products, and fertilizers. The company is also involved in the retail and wholesale trade of other commodities. In addition, it engages in lending and other activities; and operates real estate properties, as well as vessels and service stations. The company operates a network of 65 gas stations, including 48 Orkan, as well as 4 oil depots in Iceland; and 11 retail and fuel stations, and 2 oil depots in the Faroe Islands. Skeljungur hf. was founded in 1928 and is based in ReykjavÃ­k, Iceland.

SYN.IC.summary: SÃ½n hf. provides communication and media service in Iceland. VIS.IC.summary: VÃ¡tryggingafÃ©lag Ãslands hf. provides various insurance products and services in Iceland. The company operates through three segments: Casualty Insurance, Life Insurance, and Financial Activities. It offers property, marine and cargo, mandatory vehicle, other vehicle, general liability, accident and health, and life and health insurance, as well as foreign reinsurance products. The company also engages in the investment activities. It provides insurance products for construction, tourism and transportation, healthcare, fisheries, agriculture, administration, trade and service, and manufacturing and industry sectors.
